To be overridden, defines an attribute named properties_widget used in the properties toolbar

Class representing the DataNode

classmethod getOpCode()¶

Return the op_code of the node.

Corresponds to the class name definition as it should be unique. Helper function to work with NodeFactory class

initSettings()¶
getNodeSettings() → dict¶

To be overridden - should returns the node settings

restoreNodeSettings(data: dict) → bool¶

To be overridden - restore the node settings

serialize() → dict¶

Serialize the node.

Call getNodeSettings() to retrieve the node specific settings. :returns: Dictionary of node settings and parameters to serialize :rtype: dict

deserialize(data: dict, hashmap: Optional[dict] = None, restore_id: bool = True) → bool¶

Deserialize the node with corresponding data

Parameters

  • data (dict) – Serialized settings of the node

  • hashmap (dict) –

  • restore_id (bool) – if True, set the ‘id’ attribute to data[‘id’] else a new object with its own id is generated.

Returns

True if successful, False otherwise

Return type

bool

forcedEval() → Any¶

Force evaluation of the current DataNode.

Returns

Return type

Any

eval(force: bool = False) → Any¶

Evaluate this Node.

Return cached value in case no change was detected. Evaluation can be forced by setting Force to True. Otherwise, evaluate this Node by calling evalImplementation(). In case of ValueError, set the node and their children as dirty. Any other error will set the node and their children as invalid :param force: True Force evaluation of this Node. :type force: bool

Returns

Return type

Any

evalImplementation(force: bool = False)¶

Evaluation implementation of the current DataNode.

Evaluation of the node usually implements the following steps :

  • get values of the inputs

  • handle errors :

    • mark invalid and DescendantDirty

    • set tooltip with error message

  • reset the states of the Node : un-Dirty and Valid

  • store the current evaluation in self.value

  • reset tooltip

  • markDescendantDirty(True) :py:meth:’~data_node_base.DataNode.markDescendantInvalid(False)’

  • evaluate the children of the Node

  • return current evaluation

onInputChanged(socket: Socket) → Any¶

Event called when an Edge is connected to the inputs

Parameters

socket ('Socket') –
